tool.name: gmt_music_play
tool.description: Run the full suite of MuSiC tools sequentially.
tool.help:
**USAGE**
gmt music play --bam-list=? --genetic-data-type=? --maf-file=? --output-dir=? --pathway-file=? --reference-sequence=? --roi-file=? [--aa-range=?] [--bmr=?] [--categorical-clinical-data-file=?] [--cosmic-dir=?] [--genes-to-ignore=?] [--max-fdr=?] [--max-proximity=?] [--min-mapq=?] [--min-mut-genes-per-path=?] [--normal-min-depth=?] [--nuc-range=?] [--numeric-clinical-data-file=?] [--omimaa-dir=?] [--permutations=?] [--processors=?] [--show-skipped] [--skip-non-coding] [--skip-silent] [--tumor-min-depth=?] [--verbose] [--wu-annotation-headers]
**SYNOPSIS**
This tool takes as parameters all the information required to run the individual tools. An example usage is:
... music play \ --bam-list input/bams_to_analyze.txt \ --numeric-clinical-data-file input/numeric_clinical_data.csv \ --maf-file input/myMAF.tsv \ --output-dir play_output_dir \ --pathway-file input/pathway_db \ --reference-sequence input/refseq/all_sequences.fa \ --roi-file input/all_coding_regions.bed \ --genetic-data-type gene
**REQUIRED ARGUMENTS**
bam-list Text Tab delimited list of BAM files [sample_name normal_bam tumor_bam] genetic-data-type Text Data in matrix file must be either "gene" or "variant" type data maf-file Text List of mutations using TCGA MAF specifications v2.2 output-dir Text Directory where output files and subdirectories will be written pathway-file Text Tab-delimited file of pathway information reference-sequence Text Path to reference sequence in FASTA format roi-file Text Tab delimited list of ROIs [chr start stop gene_name]
**OPTIONAL ARGUMENTS**
aa-range Text Set how close a 'near' match is when searching for amino acid near hits Default value '2' if not specified bmr Number Background mutation rate in the targeted regions categorical-clinical-data-file Text Table of samples (y) vs. categorical clinical data category (x) cosmic-dir Path cosmic amino acid mutation database folder genes-to-ignore Text Comma-delimited list of genes to ignore for background mutation rates max-fdr Number The maximum allowed false discovery rate for a gene to be considered an SMG max-proximity Text Maximum AA distance between 2 mutations min-mapq Integer The minimum mapping quality of reads to consider towards read depth counts min-mut-genes-per-path Number Pathways with fewer mutated genes than this will be ignored normal-min-depth Integer The minimum read depth to consider a Normal BAM base as covered nuc-range Text Set how close a 'near' match is when searching for nucleotide position near hits Default value '5' if not specified numeric-clinical-data-file Text Table of samples (y) vs. numeric clinical data category (x) omimaa-dir Path omim amino acid mutation database folder permutations Number Number of permutations used to determine P-values processors Integer number of processors to use in SMG (requires 'foreach' and 'doMC' R packages) show-skipped Boolean Report each skipped mutation, not just how many Default value 'false' (--noshow-skipped) if not specified noshow-skipped Boolean Make show-skipped 'false' skip-non-coding Boolean Skip non-coding mutations from the provided MAF file Default value 'true' if not specified noskip-non-coding Boolean Make skip-non-coding 'false' skip-silent Boolean Skip silent mutations from the provided MAF file Default value 'true' if not specified noskip-silent Boolean Make skip-silent 'false' tumor-min-depth Integer The minimum read depth to consider a Tumor BAM base as covered verbose Boolean turn on to display larger working output Default value 'true' if not specified noverbose Boolean Make verbose 'false' wu-annotation-headers Boolean Use this to default to wustl annotation format headers nowu-annotation-headers Boolean Make wu-annotation-headers 'false'
**DESCRIPTION**
This command can be used to run all of the MuSiC analysis tools on a set of data. Please see the individual tools for further description of the parameters.
